alert.note: Alert for Montgomery; Philadelphia (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 19 at 1:43AM EDT until April 19 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Pennsylvania...including the following counties...Montgomery and Philadelphia. * WHEN...Until 800 AM EDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 143 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - For Wissahickon Creek at Fort Washington: At 1:30am the stage was 9.48 feet. Flood Stage is 10 feet. ... For Wissahickon Creek at Wissahickon: At 1:00am the stage was 4.28 feet. Flood Stage is 5 feet. - This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 336 and 338. Interstate 76 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 338 and 340. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
